title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 18): Local Currencies & Mutual Credit - Reclaiming Value Through Collective Trust
summary: Develop local currencies and mutual credit networks as forms of economic self-determination. Shift economic power from banks back into relationships between neighbors through cooperative exchange systems.

Money.summary: Create alternative currency systems that serve community needs rather than extraction and accumulation.

level0: Form core group of 3-8 people committed to community economic wellbeing
Clarify purpose and scope - what is your currency/credit system for?
level1: Choose model: local currency or mutual credit based on community needs
Design governance using flat, participatory methods
level2: Map and onboard participants - producers, service providers, individuals
Launch pilot exchange round with transparent transactions
level3: Build network of connected alternative currency systems

Community.summary: Build economic relationships based on trust and cooperation rather than profit and competition.

level0: Use consensus or modified consensus for all governance decisions
level1: Avoid screening participants by income, background, or employment
Design mechanisms to prevent large negative balances
level2: Keep system co-created and governed by users - no owners or banks
Use events and direct outreach to build participation
level3: Create permanent infrastructure for community-controlled exchange
Model cooperative economics for broader transformation

Knowledge.summary: Learn alternative economics while sharing knowledge about community-controlled currency systems.

level0: Learn about local currency models and mutual credit systems
level1: Develop skills in participatory governance and system design
Learn about trust mechanisms and default prevention
level2: Teach others about economic democracy and community currencies
Share knowledge about alternatives to state and corporate money
level3: Become resource for community currency development
Create educational materials about economic sovereignty

Narrative.summary: Challenge dominant narratives about money and value toward community-controlled alternatives.

level0: Practice understanding money as tool rather than measure of worth
Challenge narratives about scarcity and competition
level1: Share stories about successful community currencies
level2: Help others understand economic alternatives to capitalism
Promote local economic sovereignty and democracy
level3: Transform community understanding of value and exchange
Build culture where cooperative economics is normalized
